meanings.definition: Caulds (noun): A Scottish term for cold weather.
meanings.sent1: The caulds made everyone bundle up in warm coats.
meanings.sent2: The caulds of winter arrived early this year.
meanings.sent3: Despite the caulds, the children still enjoyed building snowmen.
meanings.sent4: The caulds outside were like a blanket of frost covering the land.
meanings.sent5: The caulds nipped at their noses as they walked through the snowy village.

meanings.definition: Caulds (adjective): Feeling or characterized by extreme coldness.
meanings.sent1: She shivered in the cauld wind blowing through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The cauld metal of the doorknob sent a chill through his hand.
meanings.sent3: The cauld ice cream melted quickly in the summer sun.
meanings.sent4: His cauld demeanor matched the icy stare he gave her.
meanings.sent5: The cauld air froze the leaves on the trees, creating a winter wonderland.
